hw2

Class Wheel

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw2.Wheel

  • public class Wheel
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates information about the state of the wheel for a wheel of fortune game. The state of the wheel is represented by its counterclockwise rotation in degrees. The wheel represented by this class has 24 segments each covering 15 degrees of rotation. The value associated with each segment is fixed and is given by an internal array of values (WHEEL_SEGMENTS). The rotation is always between 1 and 359, with exact multiples of 15 degrees disallowed.

      Constant representing the "lose a turn" wheel segment.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Wheel()
      Constructs a new game wheel with an initial rotation of 359 degrees.

      • getRotation

        Returns:
        segment value for current rotation

      • spin

        public void spin(int degrees)
        Adds the given number of degrees to the wheel's position. If adding the given number would cause the rotation to be an exact multiple of 15, then 1 is subtracted. The result is wrapped so that the end result is between 1 and 359 (inclusive). (Note that the argument may be negative.)
        Parameters:
        degrees - number of degrees to spin the wheel
